\usepackage{mathrsfs}
\usepackage{amsthm}

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\title{Model for transmission of SARS-CoV-2 on a university campus}

\maketitle
The system of ordinary differential equations for this model is
\begin{align*}
\dot{S} & =-\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)S,\\
\dot{L} & =\left(1-a\right)\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)S-\left(\sigma+\xi\right)L,\\
\dot{A} & =a\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)S-\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right)A,\\
\dot{I} & =\sigma L-\gamma_{I}I,\\
\dot{R} & =\gamma_{I}I+\gamma_{A}A+\xi L+\xi A.
\end{align*}
We can simplify the notation by defining
\begin{align*}
f & =\left(1-a\right)\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right),\\
g & =a\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)
\end{align*}
Let $N=S+L+A+I+R$ represent the total population. Then $\dot{N}=0$.
Thus the disease-free equilibrium is given by $S_{0}=N\left(0\right)-R\left(0\right)$,
and all other state variables are equal to zero.

The infectious compartments are represented by $L$, $A$, and $I$.
Let $x$ be the vector of state variables, ordered with infected compartments
first: $x=\left(L,A,I,S,R\right)$. The DFE is then $x_{0}=\left(0,0,0,S_{0},R_{0}\right)$.
Define $\mathscr{F}$ and $\mathscr{V}$ to be the rate of new infections
and net rate out (for any other transition), for the infected compartments:
\[
\mathscr{F}\left(x\right)=\begin{pmatrix}\left(1-a\right)\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)S\\
a\beta\left(I+b_{L}L+b_{A}A\right)S\\
0
\end{pmatrix},\,\mathscr{V}\left(x\right)=\begin{pmatrix}\left(\sigma+\xi\right)L\\
\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right)A\\
\gamma_{I}I-\sigma L
\end{pmatrix}
\]
Let $F=D_{x}\mathscr{F}\left(x_{0}\right)$ and $V=D_{x}\mathscr{V}\left(x_{0}\right)$
where
\begin{align*}
D_{x}\mathscr{F}\left(x\right) & =\begin{pmatrix}\left(1-a\right)\beta Sb_{L} & \left(1-a\right)\beta Sb_{A} & \left(1-a\right)\beta S\\
a\beta Sb_{L} & a\beta Sb_{A} & a\beta S\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{pmatrix},\\
D_{x}\mathscr{V}\left(x\right) & =\begin{pmatrix}\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 0\\
0 & \left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right) & 0\\
-\sigma & 0 & \gamma_{I}
\end{pmatrix}
\end{align*}
Thus 
\begin{align*}
F & =\begin{bmatrix}\left(1-a\right)\beta b_{L}S_{0} & \left(1-a\right)\beta b_{A}S_{0} & \left(1-a\right)\beta S_{0}\\
a\beta S_{0}b_{L} & a\beta S_{0}b_{A} & a\beta S_{0}\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix},\\
V & =\begin{bmatrix}\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 0\\
0 & \left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right) & 0\\
-\sigma & 0 & \gamma_{I}
\end{bmatrix}.
\end{align*}
The basic reproduction number is defined as the spectral radius of
the next generation matrix $K=FV^{-1}$ which is given by:
\begin{align*}
K & =\begin{bmatrix}\left(1-a\right)\beta b_{L}S_{0} & \left(1-a\right)\beta b_{A}S_{0} & \left(1-a\right)\beta S_{0}\\
a\beta S_{0}b_{L} & a\beta S_{0}b_{A} & a\beta S_{0}\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1/\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 0\\
0 & 1/\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right) & 0\\
\sigma/\gamma_{I}\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 1/\gamma_{I}
\end{bmatrix}\\
 & =\beta S_{0}\begin{bmatrix}\left(1-a\right)b_{L} & \left(1-a\right)b_{A} & \left(1-a\right)\\
ab_{L} & ab_{A} & a\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1/\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 0\\
0 & 1/\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi\right) & 0\\
\sigma/\gamma_{I}\left(\sigma+\xi\right) & 0 & 1/\gamma_{I}
\end{bmatrix}\\
 & =\beta S_{0}\begin{bmatrix}\left(1-a\right)\left[b_{L}\frac{1}{\sigma+\xi}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi}\right)\right] & \left(1-a\right)b_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi}\right) & \left(1-a\right)\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\right)\\
a\left[b_{L}\frac{1}{\sigma+\xi}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi}\right)\right] & ab_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi}\right) & a\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\right)\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
\end{align*}
To simplify this calculation, let $c_{1}=\beta S_{0}\left[b_{L}\frac{1}{\sigma+\xi}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi}\right)\right]$,
$c_{2}=\beta S_{0}b_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi}\right)$ and
$c_{3}=\beta S_{0}\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}$. Then $K$ can be written
simply as:
\[
K=\begin{bmatrix}\left(1-a\right)c_{1} & \left(1-a\right)c_{2} & \left(1-a\right)c_{3}\\
ac_{1} & ac_{2} & ac_{3}\\
0 & 0 & 0
\end{bmatrix}
\]
and the eigenvalues of $K$ are zero (multiplicity 2) and, the largest
eigenvalue, $\left(1-a\right)c_{1}+ac_{2}$. This last eigenvalue
must be the spectral radius. Substituting back in the original parameters,
we obtain: 
\[
\mathcal{R}_{0}=\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)\left[b_{L}\frac{1}{\left(\sigma+\xi\right)}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi}\right)\right]+\beta S_{0}ab_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi}\right)
\]
This can be decomposed to represent the contribution to the basic
reproduction number of the symptomatic ($\mathcal{R}_{L}+\mathcal{R}_{I}$)
and asymptomatic classes ($\mathcal{R}_{A}$):
\begin{align*}
\mathcal{R}_{L} & =\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)b_{L}\frac{1}{\left(\sigma+\xi\right)},\\
\mathcal{R}_{I} & =\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi}\right),\\
\mathcal{R}_{A} & =\beta S_{0}ab_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi}\right).
\end{align*}


\section*{Finding the critical value of $\xi$}

The testing rate, $\xi$, is an important control parameter. The basic
reproduction number can be brought below unity by increasing this
value. We compute the value $\xi_{c}$ at which $\mathcal{R}_{0}=1$.
\begin{align*}
1 & =\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)\left[b_{L}\frac{1}{\left(\sigma+\xi_{c}\right)}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\left(\frac{\sigma}{\sigma+\xi_{c}}\right)\right]+\beta S_{0}ab_{A}\left(\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}+\xi_{c}}\right)\\
\left(\sigma+\xi_{c}\right)\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi_{c}\right) & =\beta S_{0}\left[\left(\gamma_{A}+\xi_{c}\right)\left(1-a\right)\left(b_{L}+\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}}\sigma\right)+\left(\sigma+\xi_{c}\right)ab_{A}\right]
\end{align*}
Define the following reproduction numbers without control:
\begin{align*}
\mathcal{R}_{L0} & =\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)b_{L}\frac{1}{\sigma},\\
\mathcal{R}_{I0} & =\beta S_{0}\left(1-a\right)\frac{1}{\gamma_{I}},\\
\mathcal{R}_{A0} & =\beta S_{0}ab_{A}\frac{1}{\gamma_{A}},\\
\mathcal{R}_{0} & =\mathcal{R}_{L0}+\mathcal{R}_{I0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}.
\end{align*}
Then the above simplfies to the following equation:
\begin{align*}
\xi_{c}^{2}+\left[\sigma\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)+\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)\right]\xi_{c}+\sigma\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}\right)=0
\end{align*}
This can have two solutions:
\[
\xi^{\pm}=-\frac{1}{2}\left[\sigma\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)+\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)\right]\pm\frac{1}{2}\sqrt{\left[\sigma\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)+\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)\right]^{2}+4\sigma\gamma_{A}\left(\mathcal{R}_{0}-1\right)},
\]
only one of which is positive since $\xi^{+}\xi^{-}=\sigma\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}\right)<0$.
Hence the critical value of $\xi$ is:
\[
\xi_{c}=-\frac{1}{2}\left[\sigma\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)+\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)\right]+\frac{1}{2}\sqrt{\left[\sigma\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{0}+\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)+\gamma_{A}\left(1-\mathcal{R}_{A0}\right)\right]^{2}+4\sigma\gamma_{A}\left(\mathcal{R}_{0}-1\right)}.
\]

\end{document}
